docs.lead_paragraph: HAZLETON, Penn., Sept. 17. -- The grear struggle between the anthracite coal miners of Pennsylvania and their employers was begun to-day. Each side is confident of winning, and neither of the contending forces shows any disposition to yield.

headline.main: AT STRIKE HEADQUARTERS.; President Mitchell Claims 112,000 Men Have Gone Out -- The Question of Arbitration.

docs.abstract: One Hundred and Eighteen Thousand Men Claimed to be Idle; Markle & Co.'s Reply to Men; Operators Offer 10 Per Cent. Advance
docs.snippet: HAZLETON, Penn., Sept. 17. -- The grear struggle between the anthracite coal miners of Pennsylvania and their employers was begun to-day. Each side is confident of winning, and neither of the contending forces shows any disposition to yield.
